info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:55PM CDT until May 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHITA...SOUTHEASTERN ROGER MILLS...WESTERN CUSTER...SOUTHWESTERN DEWEY AND NORTHEASTERN BECKHAM COUNTIES... At 454 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Putnam to 3 miles northwest of Elk City, moving northeast at 15 mph. The largest hail is located with the storm near Butler. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Hammon, Canute, Leedey, Butler, Moorewood, Foss Reservoir, Berlin and Stafford. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
